lead_paragraph: A commission found serious rights violations by security forces in a 2015 raid on a gang-occupied ranch in which 42 civilians and one officer died.

headline.print_headline: Mexico Police Executed 22 in Raid, Rights Agency Says
headline.main: Mexican Federal Police Executed 22 People in Raid, Rights Group Says

snippet: A commission found serious rights violations by security forces in a 2015 raid on a gang-occupied ranch in which 42 civilians and one officer died....
abstract: Mexico's National Human Rights Commission says federal police officers used excessive force in executing 22 people in raid on ranch serving as refuge for armed drug gang; finding is setback for country's security forces and Pres Enrique Pena Nieto, whose government has failed to present effective proposals for fighting drug cartels.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
